metadata.description: Required. Name of the Azure Recovery Service Vault.
Optional. The storage configuration for the Azure Recovery Service Vault.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. List of all backup policies.
Optional. The backup configuration.
Optional. List of all protection containers.
Optional. List of all replication fabrics.
Optional. List of all replication policies.
Optional. Specifies the number of days that logs will be kept for; a value of 0 will retain data indefinitely.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Tags of the Recovery Service Vault resource.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting, if deployed.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Conditional. The name of the parent Azure Recovery Service Vault. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The recovery location the fabric represents.
Optional. The name of the fabric.
Optional. Replication containers to create.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).

resources.name: [format('{0}-RCont-{1}', deployment().name, copyIndex())]

metadata.description: Conditional. The name of the parent Azure Recovery Service Vault. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The name of the parent Replication Fabric. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the replication container.
Optional. Replication containers mappings to create.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).

resources.name: [format('{0}-Map-{1}', deployment().name, copyIndex())]

metadata.description: Conditional. The name of the parent Azure Recovery Service Vault. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The name of the parent Replication Fabric. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The name of the parent source Replication container. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. Resource ID of the target Replication container. Must be specified if targetContainerName is not. If specified, targetContainerFabricName and targetContainerName will be ignored.
Optional. Name of the fabric containing the target container. If targetProtectionContainerId is specified, this parameter will be ignored.
Optional. Name of the target container. Must be specified if targetProtectionContainerId is not. If targetProtectionContainerId is specified, this parameter will be ignored.
Optional. Resource ID of the replication policy. If defined, policyName will be ignored.
Optional. Name of the replication policy. Will be ignored if policyId is also specified.
Optional. The name of the replication container mapping. If not provided, it will be automatically generated as `<source_container_name>-<target_container_name>`.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
The name of the replication container.

resourceId.value: [resourceId('Microsoft.RecoveryServices/vaults/replicationFabrics/replicationProtectionContainers/replicationProtectionContainerMappings', split(format('{0}/{1}/{2}/{3}', parameters('recoveryVaultName'), parameters('replicationFabricName'), parameters('sourceProtectionContainerName'), variables('mappingName')), '/')[0], split(format('{0}/{1}/{2}/{3}', parameters('recoveryVaultName'), parameters('replicationFabricName'), parameters('sourceProtectionContainerName'), variables('mappingName')), '/')[1], split(format('{0}/{1}/{2}/{3}', parameters('recoveryVaultName'), parameters('replicationFabricName'), parameters('sourceProtectionContainerName'), variables('mappingName')), '/')[2], split(format('{0}/{1}/{2}/{3}', parameters('recoveryVaultName'), parameters('replicationFabricName'), parameters('sourceProtectionContainerName'), variables('mappingName')), '/')[3])]

metadata.description: The resource ID of the replication container.
The name of the resource group the replication container was created in.
